thread.title: James McClean to wear No.5 shirt for Republic of Ireland against Wales in poignant tribute to late Ryan McBride
thread.title_full: James McClean to wear No.5 shirt for Republic of Ireland against Wales in poignant tribute to late Ryan McBride

author: Paul O'Hehir
title: James McClean to wear No.5 shirt for Republic of Ireland against Wales in poignant tribute to late Ryan McBride
text:
Sport James McClean to wear No.5 shirt for Republic of Ireland against Wales in poignant tribute to late Ryan McBride McBride, who died on Sunday, wore the No.5 shirt for Derry City and McClean wants to pay his own respects to his close friend Share McClean usually wears the No.11 shirt (Photo: Sportsfile) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
James McClean is set to wear the No.5 shirt in Ireland's clash with Wales as a tribute to late friend Ryan McBride. 
West Brom midfielder McClean was left "devastated" after former Derry City team-mate McBride suddenly died on Sunday. 
The football world was stunned by the news that the Derry City captain had been found dead aged just 27 at his home with his funeral scheduled for Thursday . 
McClean has been given permission to attend the funeral, with Ireland taking on Wales in a World Cup qualifier on Friday night. 
He is set to play in the encounter and wear the No.5 shirt, worn by McBride for Derry, reports the Irish Mirror. McClean celebrates scoring (Photo: REUTERS) Ryan McBride of Derry City (Photo: Sportsfile) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now James McClean's video of reported tribute to Ryan McBride Share this video Watch Next 
McClean usually sports the No 11 shirt on international duty with Ireland. 
But he will wear the No 5 that McBride donned with distinction for the Candystripes after getting defender Richard Keogh’s blessing. 
Speaking on Tuesday, Roy Keane tipped McClean to play against Wales. Ryan McBride's coffin is carried (Photo: PA) Ryan McBride's coffin is carried (Photo: PA) A mural in Brandywell, Derry of Ryan McBride (Photo: PA) 
The 27-year-old has been Ireland’s talisman in this World Cup campaign with three goals in his last two games, including the winner in Austria. 
“If he played like he trained today then I’d be pretty happy,” said Keane last night. 
“It was shocking news about the young kid Ryan. As professionals we do have to get focussed on the game. You have to also pay your respects. 
“Sometimes you pay your respects by how you play in the game. That’s part of our job I’m afraid.” Like us on Facebook
